boardgame.name: Old School Tactical: Volume 1 – 2nd Edition: Red Blitz
boardgame.description:
In the vein of Old School Tactical Vol 2's Phantom Division we present Red Blitz. To be sold during the Kickstarter for Old School Tactical Vol I 2nd Edition, this boxed expansion will add more scenarios that occur during the vicious fighting of Operation Bagration in the summer of 1944.

Specifically, there are 6 challenging new scenarios, and an extended battle to be gamed on Vol I's Map 1. The extended battle is a multi-part legacy scenario, where the day's gains remain in your hands and reinforcements are fed into the battle. A running score is kept and the winning side is determined at the end of all the rounds.

The "one-off" scenarios are fought on 4 new pocket maps, depicting summer and winter terrain. Additionally, Red Blitz presents new combatants, including the SU-76M, SU-85, OT-34, PT34, ISU-152, IS-2StuH-42 and the Nashorn.

Red Blitz Includes:

4 new 11" x 17" game maps (2 x summer and 2 x winter).
a playbook with 6 new scenarios and a separate, new campaign.
a sheet of gorgeous counters, including--but not limited to-- the new units cited above.
a box to keep everything safe and warm.
This is an expansion. You must own Old School Tactical Vol I 2nd Edition to play.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Old School Tactical (Flying Pig Games)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Old School Tactical: Volume 1 – Fighting on the Eastern Front 1941/42

boardgame.name: Old School Tactical: Volume 1 – 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Old School Tactical is the first in a dynamic series of fresh, tactical war games. OST simulates, through an easily-learned game system, small unit engagements on the Eastern Front during 1941-42.

Two players contest each scenario using counters representing the soldiers, guns, and vehicles that fought these desperate battles. On each turn play goes back and forth between the sides as Impulse Points are spent to enable a player's forces to act. When the battle is over, casualty and victory points are tallied and a victor is declared.

Infantry target other soft units and attack using their Firepower value against the target’s Defense value. The attack can be modified by Leadership, support weapons and terrain effects. And when things get intense, Assault moves into enemy hexes result in deadly Close Combat. Dice rolls are made using the Infantry Combat Table and results are implemented. Attacking armored vehicles requires a roll to Hit the vehicle at range. If a Hit is scored, the Firepower value of the attacker’s gun is used against the target’s front or flank Defense value. Dice rolls are made using the Vehicle Combat Table and results are enforced. Vehicles may also use their HE Firepower value and secondary armaments directly against soft targets using the Infantry Combat Table.

Old School Tactical (OST) Vol I is the game that started the Old School Tactical train rolling. With its huge maps, straightforward play, and realistic feel, the game was an instant hit. So much of a hit that it sold out. Sold out and was reprinted and then the reprint sold out, but now...
Now it’s back in the ring, to take another swing. Not a reprint, but a full up 2nd Edition.

What’s new? The art. The counter art.

Shayne has redone the illustrations for all the soldiers (infantry units) for both sides, and enhanced the drawings of the vehicles.

The rules. Old School Tactical Vol I 2nd Edition comes with the absolute latest, bleeding edge OST rules. OST version.

The player aids. The Vol I Player Aid Cards have been brought up to the latest standards that includes the latest Vehicle Combat Table, which changed after the original printing.

Scenarios. The scenarios include corrections necessitated by errata, as well as a layout upgrade to bring them in line with Vol II and Vol III. Additionally, the game boosts 2 new tutorial scenarios, playable by newbies and grognards alike.

--description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Old School Tactical (Flying Pig Games)
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Old School Tactical: Volume 1 – Fighting on the Eastern Front 1941/42

boardgame.name: Animanize
boardgame.description:
Circus-themed trick-taking game.
Collect animals with special skills.
However, if you collect too much, the animals will fight each other.

boardgame.name: Small Samurai Empires: Rise of Tokugawa
boardgame.description:
Rise of Tokugawa is an expansion for Small Samurai Empires, including a 5th player, solo mode, training grounds, a playmat and more!

As house Tokugawa rises to power, many of the daimyos prepare for the inevitable – an all-out war between the houses. No-one is safe, not even within the great castle walls.

Train your Samurai to be invincible warriors. Deploy archers, elite units and generals and use your unique tactics to bring an advantage to the battlefield. Prepare for siege and glorious battles. For glory and honor!

boardgame.name: Bushido: Shinyuki
boardgame.description:
Shinyuki is fearsome in word, act, visage and deed. A combat-centric member of the infamous Bleeding Moon, he excells in death, stealth and being prepared to deal with any situation. Being able to react fluidly counts massively when on missions, which makes this Shadows Crow the terrifying foe he is. His weapon of choice is the Kama: a short, sickle-like weapon that can slice and punch through the stoutest of armour. He loves it so much that he fights with one in each hand, and when in motion, they are a wall of slicing steel. He hides his identity behind a fearsome mask that stupefies his enemies for a second or two when they see it. They often realise - correctly - that this will be the last thing they see on this earth, and the hesitation is all he needs to strike first.

Shinyuki is a combat model that will excel at putting Damage and Bleed Markers on your enemy models. The Slice Ki Feat is expensive, but the damage can be worth it as it often turns a hit into a kill with a whopping Bleed 3 Marker. The ability to get Melee Boost 2 can help if locked in a protracted combat as you can get that higher Melee Pool every turn. The best use of this model may be to finish off a wounded enemy and use the Escape Ki Feat to reposition for Camouflage and Distance from the enemy. This moderate rice cost melee toolbox opens a lot of options for Bleeding Moon players.

Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.

boardgame.name: Mister X
boardgame.description: In the territory of Yugoslavia, there is MISTER X, whom the detectives are looking for, and in case they find hope, they win, otherwise MISTER X wins. The players first agree on who will be MISTER X, and the others detectives.

boardgame.name: Cyber Odyssey: Route 666
boardgame.description:
Explore the Toxic lands around New Eden, and find new skillfull Agents, vehicules or equipments. But, also, face new adversaries and take part in the events going on around these abandoned places.

Includes 5 new agents, their miniatures and cards. 5 new henchmen, their miniatures and cards. 1 new district board. A new double sided tactical board. 26 new equipment tokens. 15 loot, 12 event and 3 support cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cyber Odyssey: Law and Order
boardgame.description:
Police forces trying to see what your Organization is doing! Police officers and special forces join the game as henchman.

Includes 2 new agents, their miniatures and cards. 10 new henchmen, their miniatures and cards. 20 Police mission cards and 4 order tokens. 62 new cards that includes 48 Bounty Hunter, 5 evasion, 5 android and 4 support. And 16 new equipment tokens.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cyber Odyssey: In Real Life
boardgame.description:
Expand your Organization in two different ways. Acquire buildings and build your own city network. And add connections to your social network to get more influence over NEW EDEN!

Includes 2 new agents, their miniatures and cards. 4 hideout boards and 20 tokens. 4 network boards and tokens. 48 contact tokens.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Village
boardgame.description:
The Village is a 2-4 player cooperative board game that sees players work together to build a new village while trying to overcome a host of potential threats ranging from plagues, famine to even wars.

The game requires players to work together to overcome a,series of potentially devastating events to see if they can build a village large enough to become its own town. During their turn, players can draw or play cards and must select and resolve and event card. Play continues until either a Town hall card is played, or all players lose their 3 lives (3 events).

The game balances elements of strategy and luck as players decide to best build their city to survive the different upcoming challenges that many come their way.

boardgame.name: Cyber Odyssey: Alone Against the Machine
boardgame.description:
Play alone against other Organizations and also police forces that will not necessarily protect and serve you...
They might have a whole different agenda.

Also, beware, because one of your Agents may be a traitor!

Includes Ladder board and tokens. 172 cards, including behavior, tactical, features, strategy and henchmen. And various tokens to use with solo.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Παιγνίδι Ερωτήσεων: Ταξιδεύοντας στην Ε.Ο.Κ.
boardgame.description:
This is a light family game that consists of two smaller games.

The first one is a game of questions, like the trivial pursuit. You roll the die, you move on the board and you answer to a question of the color that you landed on.

The second game is a roll and move game. You start from Thessaloniki, Greece and and travel through Europe with Bruxelles being the final destination. The first one reaches Bruxelles, wins. Every stop of the way, you have to follow a specific rule. The title is Travelling in the EE but in the years 1958 – 1993 it was a greek acronym that translates as European Economic Area (E.O.K.)

—user summary

boardgame.name: ナンバース (NumVS)
boardgame.description:
ナンバース (NumVS) is a quick trick taking card game from Japan for two players.

The deck has a set of cards for both players, numbered 3,5,7,10 and an Overwork card. And there is a set of 5 Skills cards. Each player takes their hand cards, and the skill cards are shuffled and dealt two to each player. The fifth Skill card is discarded unseen.

Each round, a player chooses one of their Skill cards face-down, and then both players choose a number card face-down. The cards are turned up and the highest number wins. However, the Skill cards affect the outcome. So players have to be careful in their choices. They know which cards have already been played, and can use their combination of Skill and numbers to win the rounds.

The player that wins the round takes the number card of the other player as their score. At the end, the players add up all the cards won, and the highest total wins.
user summary

boardgame.name: Distant Suns
boardgame.description:
Your journey is beginning in the known part of the universe. Humanity discovered faster-than-light space travel and we need space explorers. The stars shining above us, as distant as ever, are now within reach! It's our turn to weigh anchor! You will have to explore it and map the galaxy!

In Distant Suns, you will try to get as many victory points as possible over three rounds. On your turn, you choose and write a figure on a free Exploration Zone and force your opponents to draw another one on theirs. Encounter aliens, upgrade your ship, discover treasure, and explore black holes and the outer world of the cosmos to become the most famous space explorer of the galaxy! The player with the most victory points after three rounds wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Laserox Hogwarts Battle Organizer
boardgame.description:
Wands at the ready! The dark forces are gathering around Hogwarts and it's up to you to protect the school and your fellow students. Take up the role of Harry, Ron, Hermione and Neville and get ready to fight the dark forces. Learn and cast spells, use your allies wisely and work together to drive off the bad guys before they overtake the school.

We've cast a handy little organizer spell at the gamebox to hold not only the basegame, but 2 expansions as well. The two token trays have plenty of space to store the tokens in everyone's easy reach during battle.

Features:

fits the base game and 2 expansions
card holder with 6 dividers, also fits the original - cardboard dividers
2 stackable, 4-compartment, engraved token trays
the token trays fit in the middle section of the card holder


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts
Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – The Monster Box of Monsters Expansion

boardgame.name: Creators of the First Dawn
boardgame.description:
Creators Of The First Dawn is a turn-based building strategy game for 2-6 players.

And so it begins, the first morning on a new world. Equipped with omnipotent magic powers and armies of underlings, each player slips into the role of a deity in the struggle for supremacy. With only their goal in mind, they endanger their own creation and set the world ablaze.

Into an empty universe, players create a three-dimensional game world. The players acquire resources in order to conquer the territory of the other players with their forces. At the same time, their god can cast more powerful spells turn by turn and thus decisively influence the game.

The goal of the game is to defeat all of the opponents' units so that their god cannot return to the world. One's own tactics and the behavior of the opponents always give the game captivating twists and make the events unpredictable.

The turn-based building system gives new players the opportunity to gradually familiarize themselves with it during their first game. But Creators Of The First Dawn also offers new challenges to experienced players. The basic rules can be supplemented with modifications to freely shape the level of complexity of the game and shift the tactical focus according to one's own wishes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Laserox Ares Organizer
boardgame.description:
More compact than its big brother or sister both in size and playtime, but giving you a similar game experience with slightly altered mechanics, the Ares Expedition is a standalone game in the Terraforming Mars universe. As the heads of influential corporations, your goal is common: to make the red planet habitable by building oceans and raising temperature and oxygen levels. But everyone is striving to achieve this by gaining the most Terraforming Rating along the way. This will need clever planning of what resources to produce to make the most out of the available project cards.

A successful terraformer needs an organized toolbox, so we designed our Ares Organizer to assist you in your missions. The natural, wooden components and the thematic engravings will not only level up your tabletop view but also upgrade your gamebox and decrease set up and clear up time.

Features:

card storage box with variable dividers, fitting the original cardboard dividers
2 cube storage boxes with slanted bottoms to ease taking out the cubes
hex tile tray with 3 slots for the 2 kinds of forest VP tiles and the ocean tiles
player cube tray with dedicated space for phase tiles
thematic embellishments on the trays
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition Promo Cards

boardgame.name: Call to Adventure: Laserox Adventure Organizer
boardgame.description:
Create the story and follow the life of your hero from their origins to their glorious (or not-so-glorious) destinies. In this storytelling game, you’ll build the personality of your hero’s character, acquire traits, face challenges and overcome various adversaries providing that the runes will be in your favour along the way – you may choose to increase your chances of success by getting into a shady business that may raise your corruption level but will payout in the end; it’s up to you to weigh what will best serve your character’s development.

To accompany you and your hero along the way, we’ve created an organizer that fits Call to Adventure the base game and the Name of the Wind Expansion in one box. All the components have neat storage that fits comfortably in the game box and will make your gametable organized during play sessions.

Features:

fits premium sleeved cards (tested with SWAN)
two rune holder trays
engraved character card holder with slanted dividers
engraved hero, antihero and solo/coop card holder
4-legged experience token holder
4-legged holder for the expansion tokens
3 story card holders – clip the front side upside-down to - tilt the tray for easy reach
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Call to Adventure: The Name of the Wind

boardgame.name: Undaunted: Normandy – Laserox Normandy Organizer
boardgame.description:
The set is World War II, the American forces just landed at the shores of Normandy, fighting their way to get inland, while the German troops are trying their best to keep their stances and stop the Americans. You are in command of a rifle platoon either on the American or the German side and guiding your riflemen and scouts through varying landscapes, mapping the area and building your forces cleverly before attacking the opposing troop.

The key to a successful attack is orderliness and this is what you can achieve by adding our organizer to your gamebox. Build the scenario easily by pulling out map tiles from their holder, keep the objective markers at hand in their designated tray, grab your army truck with your troop ready and start combat.

Features:

supports premium sleeved cards (tested with SWAN)
two unique, army truck shaped containers for player components
both trucks are engraved with player symbols
player cards storage on the flatbed
player dice storage in the cabin
player tokens storage in the engine compartment
map tile holder
objective marker tray
tray for extra accessories

boardgame.name: Imperium: Classics/Legends – Laserox Imperium Organizer
boardgame.description:
Imperium Classics and Legends. Two standalone deck building games that can be combined. Each consists of 8 nation decks, the nations in the Classic game are somewhat easier and those of the Legends are for experienced leaders seeking more challenge. Each nation has their unique strengths and weaknesses and by cleverly using your powers you’ll be guiding one of them from uncivilised barbarian horde to hopefully become the most powerful empire in the world.

If you own both games and want ot save some space, our organizer will be a great help to you, as it lets you unite both games in one box. Engravings at the deck slots will guide you to find the right place for each nation, and the compact, stackable accessory trays will provide a neat storage both inside the box between two games, and outside the box during gameplay.

Features:

fits premium sleeved cards (tested with SWAN)
card holders with acrylic dividers
holds cards of both the Classics and the Legends games
engravings help to find the dedicated places of the cards
4-storey, thematically engraved token and dice holder tray held together by a central column
holds tokens and dice from either the Classics or the Legends game

boardgame.name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 5
boardgame.description: Configure your target-interlock circuits and hold the line with technical readouts, conspiracy theories, in-depth equipment and tactics articles, a planetary digest, and a glimpse into the future of the new ilClan era"”all from BattleTech veterans and new authors.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 4
boardgame.description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine celebrates bravery in all its forms on the triumphant, BattleMech-dominated battlefields of 31st century and beyond! Witness the birth of a new mercenary command in the late Third Succession War, follow a combat medic tackling a precarious injury, learn the true meaning of loyalty during the FedCom Civil War, and track down pirates on a forgotten world in the Periphery. Then don your neurohelmet and push back against the enemy with technical readouts, ghost ship sightings, in-depth technology articles, unit digests, playable scenarios, and more"”all from BattleTech veterans and a squad of new authors.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 3
boardgame.description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine brings you more BattleMech action from the war-torn 31st century and beyond! Celebrate Star League Day with tales of a long-abandoned 'Mech rediscovered and pressed into service, a quest for vengeance in enemy territory, the resurgence of old ghosts, and the threat of bitter betrayal in the face of long odds. Charge headlong into technical readouts, assassin conspiracies, in-depth equipment articles, playable holiday-themed scenarios, and more—all from BattleTech veterans, fan favorites, and new authors.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 2
boardgame.description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine returns with more explosive BattleMech action from the 31st century! Experience tales of hard-won survival from the gaming world of Solaris VII, the wilds of the Deep Periphery, and the annals of Clan history. Dive deep into in-depth technology articles, technical readouts, conspiracy theories, war-game and role-playing adventures, and more"”all from veteran BattleTech authors, fan favorites, and our latest enlistees.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 1
boardgame.description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine continues the tradition of hard-hitting stories set in the war-torn interstellar future of the 31st century and beyond. Fire up your 'Mech's fusion reactor, secure your neurohelmet, and wade into battle with stories from the merciless front lines of the Clan Invasion and other eras, conspiracy theory articles, game scenarios, and more from veteran BattleTech authors, fan favorites, and some new recruits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Halloween
Age of Steam Expansion: Halloween & Washington DC
boardgame.description:
Introductions from the rules:
(The Halloween Map) Creepy pumpkins have appeared at all of the neighborhood houses! The only way to purge them is to hire certified witches. Can they remove the pumpkins before Halloween ends?

(Washington, D.C.) The Capital Beltway is a fast way to transport goods around the U.S. capital... until the highway traffic gets out of control!

Halloween and Washington DC are another pair of Age of Steam maps created by the highly regarded Age of Steam expansion designer Alban Viard. Together with a new edition of The Giant Maps, this pair of maps was released as part of his annual Age of Steam map set in 2021, available for purchase directly from the website of his publication firm: AVStudioGames.com.

The Washington DC map (3-4 players), a revision of the expansion previously released on the reverse side of the Berlin Wall map in 2008, focuses on the Capital Beltway, I-495. While the interstate can allow for quick goods transportation, it also becomes increasingly clogged as the game progresses and eventually becomes nearly impassable. The rules are modified slightly from the original design, increasing the likelihood of "Gridlocked" interstate hexes earlier in the game.

The Halloween map (1 player), a new entry for the Age of Steam system, is a solitaire-only puzzle wherein the player wins if they can remove all pumpkins from the map. Pumpkins are delivered only with the help of witches. The rules provide for three difficulty settings: Easy, Medium, and Difficult. In addition to the map, the player must supply 12 orange cubes (pumpkins) to play.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Tactical Map Case
boardgame.description: The Tactical Map Case is made of ABS plastic, branded for the BattleTech IP, and measures 27" x 3.75". It holds two rolled neoprene maps for a full battlefield size of 44" x 34". The case also includes a cylinder case for holding dice and a few miniatures as well, in case you want a full grab-and-go battle.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Racice River Delta/Deployment Zone Battlemat

boardgame.name: Flamencos
boardgame.description:
Flamencos is a memory and speed game for the youngest of the house. In this game the flamingos wear socks under the water!

The objective of the game is to collect the greatest number of flamingos in the lagoon, looking for their averages to coincide with the characteristic proposed by a random dice.

On each turn, the dice is rolled and everyone must choose a flamingo from the lagoon, when they are taken out of the water, whoever has a flamingo that matches the dice, wins the flamenco, the others must put them back in their place in the lagoon.

Whoever gets the most flamingos wins!

boardgame.name: Pentacular Word Circus
boardgame.description:
"Ladies and Gentlement...this is NOT your average word game!"

In this cooperative and chaotic real-time spelling game, players take on asymmetric roles of circus acrobats, magicians, and other performers, all working together to wow the audience with their amazing Feats (5-letter word challenges).


Manage a hand of Letter cards.
Play cards into any of 3 Rings.
Earn Applause when you spell a word.
Spend Applause to unlock unique circus performer abilities.


Score as many 5-letter words and Feats as you can before the musical timer ends. To win, score 55 points over three 5-minute rounds.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cholas
boardgame.description:
You are a sculptor who must prove to be the best.

After his recent victory in the war against the Pandyas, their arch rival, the Chola King decides to build a temple tower as a mark of his victory. The King, whose dynasty built thousands of temples in South India, invites sculptors from across his empire to help build the temple tower. Each sculptor is expected to bring stones from their region to build the temple together with other sculptors. The sculptors are expected to use all stones available to build. The King also sets the reward objectives for every stone and sculpture placed on the temple tower.

The sculptor can gain rewards incrementally when placing stones of other sculptors on the temple structure. When placing their own stones, the sculptor does get any reward points. But the sculptor does get points for pattern(s) created on the temple structure using their stone. Hence the objective for the sculptors would be to focus on building the temple structure with as many stones possible and creating patterns using their stone. It is important for the sculptor to ensure patterns are not created with stones of other sculptors.

The game ends when the temple tower is completely built with stones and sculptures or when a sculptor is unable to perform any of the possible actions. The sculptor with most reward points is declared as the winner or the best.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Magic Hat
boardgame.description:
A children's game based on memory. There are six hats, one is removed from the game casually. Players can watch in a hat to see the animal that is in the hat.

The first who knows which is the missing animal wins the round. When a player wins two rounds, they win the game.

Contents: 6 plastic magician’s hats, 6 ‘animal’ cards, 4 ‘magician’s hat’ tokens, 1 ‘magic wand’ token.

listing.notes: Title: Djeco GAME - Magic Hat Publisher: Djeco Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian Portugese

boardgame.name: Oscar e Max
boardgame.description:
Oscar, the king of the jungle, has to gather all his subjects. But the zebras, hippos and parrots don’t answer his call… Help Oscar to find as many animals as possible, but beware of Max: the evil monkey who’s always wreaking havoc! A wonderful game of luck that will delight little ones and test their memory.

It is a children's game based on memory.

There are some animal pieces. The player tries to say which animal is on the other side of a piece. If they are correct, they take it otherwise they put on the jungle board over other previously placed pieces on the player board.

When on the piece there is Oscar the Lion the player can say in the right order all the pieces on the Jungle Board to take all them.

If Max the monkey is on the choose piece, all pieces on the Jungle Board are lost.

Contents: 1 ‘jungle’ board, 37 wooden pieces (10 zebras, 10 hippos, 10 parrots, 6 Oscar the Lion, 1 Max the Monkey)

boardgame.name: Marvel Battleworld: Treachery at Twilight Talon Fighter
boardgame.description: This expansion adds a new playable character, Black Panther 2099, and the Talon Fighter, a game piece that moves around the board and changes the way characters perform battles.

boardgame.name: Marvel Battleworld: Treachery at Twilight The Collector's Tower
boardgame.description: The Collector's Tower adds a dice tower with multiple paths/exits and interior baffles that influence the fall of the die. Use the Twilight Sword stand to indicate which Hero gets to use the enhanced attacks provided by the unique Twilight Die which makes heroes more likely to win battles. It adds a new location tile, The Dragon's Tower.

boardgame.name: Rococo Deluxe: Expert Tailoring
boardgame.description: Expert Tailoring introduces 6 new garments, 2 of which can only be used with the Jewelry Box expansion. Each of these garments gives you a special bonus when you rent them out and place them on the game board.

listing.notes: Title: Rococo Deluxe: Expert Tailoring Publisher: Eagle-Gryphon Games

boardgame.name: Tempus Mortis
boardgame.description:
Tempus Mortis is a miniatures based MOBA game with several beautiful maps, rich characters and exciting objectives. Players can use miniatures from any system or company they want. Tempus Mortis is a free download.

2+ Players - In Tempus Mortis players will choose a map and be dealt 2 objectives, choosing one that will hopefully win them the game. Objective's can include area control, assassination's and more. Players then draft from a set of heroes that will best suit their objective. They will gain a hero character card and a deck.

Gameplay involved moving miniatures around the map via a set of basic actions or using cards that specify special moves. Heroes can all move and attack, but they also all have a set of unique abilities and passive skills that players will need to utilise to complete the game.

Solo Mode - There is a solo campaign based on one of the Tempus Mortis realms taking the player through an exotic and immersive story while completing story based objectives. The player will gain experience over time upgrading their character.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Llama Game
boardgame.description: Players/teams attempt to build a llama herd through buying, breeding, selling, and running commercial pack trips. The first player/team to accumulate $300,000 in net assets wins the game.

boardgame.name: Interplanetary
boardgame.description:
Interplanetary, a board game invented by Art Widner, was shown for the first time to The Stranger Club in late 1942 and first played at Boskone III. It included elements of Auto Race and Monopoly and added complications such as planets moving in their orbits. The game took an enormous amount of time to play: 8 or 12 hours or even more.

According to Widner: The reason it took so long is that it was a combination of a standard ‘race’ game and Monopoly. One had to get to a planet and bring back a cargo in order to finance a trip to the next distant planet where a still more valuable cargo would be obtained, etc., out to Pluto, which harbored ‘Immortality Dust,’ the game winner. The novel aspect was that the planets moved, making it difficult to land on one, plus such hazards as the ‘negasphere’ (from E. E. Smith epics -- now known as a black hole) and pirates, to say nothing of falling into the sun, getting hit with space junk, etc.

Years later, Bill Evans, Bob Pavlat, C. Stewart Metchette, and Ted White changed the rules enough to make it possible to play the game in an evening. It still didn't catch on.

boardgame.name: FreedroidClassic
boardgame.description:
FreedroidClassic is a clone of the game "Paradroid" which was released on Commodore 64 in 1985. In this game, you control a robot located within an interstellar spaceship consisting of several decks connected by elevators.

The aim of the game is to destroy all enemy robots by either shooting them or seizing control over them by creating connections in a short subgame of electric circuits. The graphics are designed to be a fairly faithful reproduction of the original game, but a modern set of tiles is also available.

Development of this game is now finished. The final version came out in august 2003 and runs on Linux, Mac OSX, Sharp Zaurus and even that strange "Windows" wannabe of an operating system. Thank you to all contributors who made this game possible.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: FreedroidRPG
boardgame.description:
The game tells the story of a world destroyed by a conflict between robots and their human masters. Play as Tux in a quest to save the world from the murderous rebel bots who know no mercy. You get to choose which path you wish to follow, and freedom of choice is everywhere in the game.

FreedroidRPG features a real time combat system with melee and ranged weapons, fairly similar to the proprietary game Diablo. There is an innovative system of programs that can be run in order to take control of enemy robots, alter their behavior, or improve one's characteristics. You can use over 50 different kinds of items and fight countless enemies on your way to your destiny. An advanced dialog system provides story background and immersive role playing situations.

The game is complete, fully playable, and can provide about 10 hours of fun. It is still being actively developed, and help is welcome in many areas. People having - or trying to acquire - programming, map editing, or writing skills will find FreedroidRPG to be an exciting, fast-moving project in which they can fully express their creativity.

Source: [ The Publisher Website].

boardgame.name: Cragne Manor
boardgame.description:
Your name is Naomi Cragne. Your husband is missing. That's why you're taking the train to Vermont, to look for him in his family's old mansion. You'll explore creepy environments, consult eldritch tomes, and solve bizarre puzzles as you search for Peter, but your surroundings, your past, and even your identity seem to change subtly—or dramatically—as you make your way through the town of Backwater and approach Cragne Manor.

Each location is a different author's take on a tribute to Anchorhead, or an original work of Lovecraftian cosmic horror, or a deconstruction of cosmic horror, or a gonzo parody of cosmic horror, or a parody of some other thing, or a portrait of life in Vermont, or a pure experiment in writing with Inform 7, or something else entirely. There are tons of puzzles. The puzzles get very weird.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Spirit Stackin' Apples
boardgame.description:
Spirit Stackin' Apples kids game transports kids to the world of DreamWorks Spirit Untamed where, just like Lucky, they can feed the beloved horses apple treats!

Two to four players take turns balancing the treats on Spirit's nose. Then, they push the button on his hoof the number of times shown on the treat. If Spirit opens his mouth and eats, that player keeps the apples. The player with the most apples at the end of the game wins! Pick the special 'yummy apple' and the player can choose to either stack it and press the hoof one time or keep the apple for their score pile.

Spirit Stackin' Apples is a fun way to pass the time and makes a great gift for kids 5 years old and up who love horses and sweet, silly fun.

-description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Enemies of Rome: The Early Republic
boardgame.description:
Exclusive Kickstarter add on two player game containing a mounted map of the "Early Republic" Ittalian peninsula, 10 "Early Republic" cards exclusive to this game and a color single sided instruction sheet of exclusive rules. Rules, cards and wooden markers from base-game necessary for play.

Game contains:

1 mounted game board
1 cover sheet/Instruction sheet
1 package of 10 game exclusive cards
1 ziplock bag

NOTE: Game requires components from base game to play.

boardgame.name: Hellenica: Story of Greece – Neoprene Playmat
boardgame.description:
This was available through the Kickstarter for the Leaders and Legends Kickstarter. It was also backer kit after the Kickstarter ended.

Neoprene Playmat - Another Cool idea from the Backers. One sided and between 10 and 25% larger than the original map - historical.

boardgame.name: Talisman Adventures Fantasy Roleplaying Game Accessory Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prepare for your next quest with the Talisman Adventures Roleplaying Game Accessory Pack! This set of 6 custom Kismet dice and 7 heavy, double-sided Fate tokens is perfect for quickly determining the fate of both heroes and monsters. Don’t enter the Dungeon without it!

boardgame.name: Fumble!
boardgame.description:
Fumble! is a fast-paced football-themed game combining cards and pong skills to make for an exciting match of skills and reflexes. Cards are dealt and Custom game ping pong balls are set on the playing surface, one less than the total number of players. An orange ball is always set on the table, and the rest are white.

Players start with 5 cards. When "HIKE!" is called, play begins. Each player passes a card to their left. Play continues until someone collects 5 cards of the same position (QB, RB, WR, CB, DL, LB). When this occurs, that player grabs the ORANGE ball in the center of the table and claims 6 points. This starts the FUMBLE! where the remaining players scramble to get one of the WHITE balls (one player is left without).

Once the balls have been claimed, players take their "kicks" by bouncing their ball off the playing surface into the cup. The white balls are worth 3 points (a field goal) and the orange ball is worth for 1 point (an extra point).

Example: In a 4 player game, Player 1 gets 5 cards of a kind first and recovers the orange ball, scoring 6 points. Players 2 and 3 each recover a white ball. Player 4 misses out on the fumble. Player 1 then "kicks" the orange ball for an extra point and players 2 & 3 get a chance to kick a field goal for 3 points.

(In a round a player can earn a max of 7 points)
The first player to get 21 points, wins.

boardgame.name: Gate Pass Gazette (Issue 0 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description:
Gate Pass Gazette
Issue 0

2022

boardgame.name: Level Up Narrator's Screen
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A three-panel, landscape-oriented, print-and-play screen.

boardgame.name: The Last Resort
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For years, Mwynhad was famous as a Feywild resort for relaxation and refreshment. Now terrible events are unfolding at the resort and adventurers are needed to solve the mystery.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 2.

CONTENT WARNING: animal abuse, oppression (aristocracy), substance (alcohol)

Playing the Pillars:
Combat: Medium-High
Explore: Low
Social: High
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Rapid Point
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We dusted this city off the other day and realized we hadn't posted it. The shopkeepers are sparse on detail but we've included a table for that to "bring the chaos"! We've even included a few scenario ideas for you!

This adventure setting was designed for any Edition D&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level of adventurer. This setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Paranormal Reality Ref
boardgame.description:
From hunting ghosts to psychic detectives to Bigfoot encounters to ancient advanced technology to aliens & UFOs— the unexplained phenomena haunt, visit, are revealed, and track down beings, things, and knowledge hidden from or beyond this world. Whether believed or unbeliever, this reference lists accounts, experiences, theories, and even a few hoax claims of paranormal events claimed as real occurrences.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Monster Ref
boardgame.description:
From giant kaiju (reptiles, insects, mammals, amphibians) to morphing hostile creatures to alien predators to malicious beings that hide in shadows and mists, monsters use their inhuman, strange, deformed, and frightening features to cause horrific acts.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results

boardgame.name: Mad for Footy: The Australian Rules Football Board Game
boardgame.description:
Mad for Footy is the Australian Rules Football Board Game that’s incredibly addictive!

Kicking big bags of goals, making turnovers at critical times and sharing memorable moments with siblings, parents, family members and friends, is what makes this game GREAT!

The aim is to score as many points as you can against your opponent, in four quarters of Australian Rules Football. Players use the dice code on the board to help move around the football field and kick goals for your team using as specially designed football counter!

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Sword & Sandal Ref
boardgame.description:
From muscular Greek heroic warriors to skillful Roman Centurians to brutal Viking warriors to Goliath slaying future-kings to Egyptian pharoahs and Jewish phrophets, sword-and-sandal media focuses on classical antiquity and the clash of ambitious rulers, large armies, and opposing cultures.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Epic & High Fantasy Ref
boardgame.description:
From lands where thrones are fought for to heroic magical sword bearers to the unlikely ring bearers epic fantasy settings bring detailed settings, heroic characters, world-changing themes, and complex plots to mostly magical filled alternative or secondary worlds.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Grimdark Ref
boardgame.description:
From the violent struggles for thrones and empires to flawed heroes and antiheroes to untrustworthy mentors and leaders, grimdark brings a little more gritty realistic look at traditionally glossy fantasy, science fiction, and even romance.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results

boardgame.name: Pinnacolando Circus
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the pleasant world of Pinnacolando Circus, where each player is an acrobat or a jester of the Italian language!
In your turn you have two possibilities: draw a card from the deck; draw any card from the discard pile, and collect all the following cards.
You can use the cards to form words of at least 5 letters to be dropped on the table, or you can lengthen words already composed.
The game ends when a player manages to lay down all his cards in his hand. At this point, each player can calculate his score by adding the values of the words created minus the cards still in his hand: whoever makes the most wins.

boardgame.name: ジャム職人さん (Jam Maker)
boardgame.description:
You are a jam maker. Let's craft a nice jam! This game includes adorable components like little jam jars and plastic rings that represent ingredients.

The play area contains seven recipe cards, a bag holding the ingredients, and jam jars to be crafted. At the beginning of each round, the player who will go last chooses where to place fresh jam ingredients. The hand-made draw bag includes a mix of eight different ingredients, and different combinations are needed to make different jams.

On their turn, a player moves their meeple to an unoccupied recipe card. Once there, they can take two actions of these three actions: take all ingredients from the card, exchange unwanted ingredients for an ingredient you want, or make the jam on the occupied recipe card. Players can take the same action twice if possible.

After a recipe card is used, it flips over to reveal a more complicated version of the jam, requiring additional ingredients and scoring more points.

Once someone makes 3 jars (4 jars for 2 people), players finish the round and the game ends.

boardgame.name: Refugee: Searching for Hope
boardgame.description:
The Refugee Searching for Hope, is a solo/cooperative game where players must work together to gather resources, build structures to create a safe path and guide the refugee to a safe place, meanwhile avoiding the "Shadow of War" that destroys and consumes everything in their way. The Refugee must reach the safe spot at any cost, even at the player's life.

On your turn you have 4 Action Points that can be spend in multiple and/pr a single action, these actions are:
-Advance on the pathway to discover the land, represented by cards of Resources/Hazards over tiles that create the pathway. But beware you cannot come back.
-Recover Resources, taking 1 Card from the pathway tiles. Be careful not to take too many resources or you will attract the attention of the militia. Look out for the “Hope Cards” this are the most valuable resources but also the most fragile and scarce.
-Guiding People, by moving a group or individual from a tile to an adjacent one by using the Resource necessary to overcome the Hazard. This is the only way to move the Refugee.
-Build a Structure, Structure provides benefits to the players and protection to the Refugee; you must build them to win special actions. This will help you and your fellow travellers.

The danger lurks! After you finish your turn, the pathway is filled with new card representing potential Resources and Hazards, but, if you reveal a “Shadow of War” Card the Shadow of War is going to move towards you, eliminating any “Hope” revealed and destroy everything in their way.

Players will win the game if they built a Campsite in the last tile of the pathway and guide successfully the Refugee to it.

But players will lose the game if any and/or multiple conditions are met:
-The Trial Deck runs out and there aren’t enough cards to refill the pathway, players run out of time and resources!
-The “Shadow of War” consumes the Refugee, you fail had fail your mission.
-All the players have been gravely injured and took out of the pathway, it was too much risk to continue, and you abandoned the refugee.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: X-rated X-mas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Så er det jul igen, og så er det jul igen. I denne søde juletid, hvor julesneen som bekendt falder hvid, er der en masse trængsel og alarm. Det er koldt og man må gå sig varm, og Far kommer hjem med fyldte lommer. Overalt i byen hænger gran, pynt og kulørte lygter. Alle folk har travlt med at planlægge den kommende højtid, og alt er dejligt. Men ...

Pynten er af plastik, som først nedbrydes om fire millarder år, granet er dyrket i petriglas-skåle på biolaboratorier, Far er ansat på livstid hos et diktatorisk mega-corp, kulden skyldes atomvinteren, og julesneen er farvet i interessante farver af de radioaktive udslip. Ih, hvor er det dejligt, det er jul.

Året er 2020. Mega-corporations sidder på alt der ligner magt, vold er en dagligdag, alle er halvt robotter og helt sindssyge. I denne vanvittige verden er der ikke længere plads til risengrød og sødsuppe. Det handler om kapital og magt. Kun i denne ene, korte måned om året standses firmaernes indbyrdes krige til ære for den store forbrugsfest. Hjerternes fest er blevet til gavernes fest, og hygge og mandelgaver er kun sagn for små og uvidende børn.

Velkommen til et julehelvede.

boardgame.name: Sig nærmer tiden
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jeg er den perfekte dræber. Tåbe som geni frygter mig. De ved, at når jeg slippes fri, knuser jeg alt på min vej. De former mig ikke i deres eget billede, men efter deres ideal. Jeg er broen mellem matematikken og deres verden. Min bane er matematik, min effekt er døden. Med mig bliver mennesket til herre over døden. Min kraft gør dem til herre over dyrene. Frygten for mig gør menneske til herre over menneske. Jeg får mennesket til at føle sig almægtig.

(projektilet)

Et scenarie om virkelighed, religion og videnskab. En mandetur dybt ind i de svenske skove, fjernt fra hysteriske kvinder og angsten for arbejdsløshed, forurening og atomkrig. I ét med naturen. Miste fornemmelsen af tiden. Blive evig. Søge den fortid der næsten var glemt. Blive menneske. Blive fuldkommen.

boardgame.name: Childsplay
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

En meget blandet gruppe mennesker bliver kastet ud i et spil, hvor virkeligheden vender vrangen ud på sig selv, og hvor hensynsløse mænd og koldblodige kvinder ligger på lur bag hvert hjørne.

Men ... Karaktererne er ikke historiens eneste hovedpersoner. Omkring ørene på vores såkaldte helte udkæmpes en kamp, hvror alle kneb gælder. Blandt de kæmpende kræfter finder vi "Freedom of Information and Regulations Enforcement", a.k.a. FIRE, gigantkoncernen "Darke/-powers" og masser af børn.

Børn er jo meget søde - med hvad ville der ske, hvis de virkelig kunne gøre, som de havde lyst til?

Og så er der jo Gud: Selvom hun/han ikke helt forstårm hvad der foregår, er Gud glad, for "evigheden" var ved at blive kedelig.

Et scenarie hvor tingene nogen gange går meget hurtigt, og hvor død og ødelæggelse lurer i heltenes fodspor, hvor vanviddet viser vejen til velsignelse. Tænk ikke på denne historie som et cyberpunk-scenarie, tænk på den som en ny religion, der spilles med toterninger.

Men det hele begynder højt oppe i luften over Metronome 2 ...

User summary:

The scenario is published as three PDF files:


41-page scenario
36-page print-and-play characters
19-page print-and-play scenario appendix

boardgame.name: M/S Titanic II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rederiet Schweindorff byder velkommen ombord her på verdens sikreste og mest ekstravagante luksusliner siden 1912. Ombord på skibet vil De finde alt til at fornøje Dem. I biografen vil vi spille de nyeste premierefilm samt de ældre klassikere. I restauranten vil verdens bedste kok, Chez Max, fornøje Deres ganer, mens kasinoet fylder Deres lommer, dog med et loft på 10.000 dollars. Derudover kan De slappe af i biblioteket, på soldækket, i pianobaren, og når aftenen er gået på hæld, kan natteravnene slå sig løs i baren. Alt dette står til Deres fulde rådighed, når Titanic II tager på jomfrurejse.

Vil historien gentage sig? Hvad vil der ske, når mørket falder på? Og hvem er den gennemblødte og gennemsigtige person i sofaen derovre?

Alt dette og meget mere vil du få besvaret, mens vi forsøger at sætte ny Atlanterhavsrekord, hvis du lægger billet ind på Titanic II.

boardgame.name: 8 Ball Pool The Board Game
boardgame.description:
In this highly strategic board game, opposing teams must race to pocket their group of balls first, for a chance to end the game by pocketing the 8 ball for the win. Take advantage of unique movement mechanics such as shot selection, controlled positional play, dead ball extractions, tactical safety play, rebound doubles, combination shots and more. The game gets more and more intense as both players fight to control the board and edge closer to the 8 ball.

The Game starts by dealing out the breaking cards to form the starting layout of the game. Two groups of balls (solid & stripes) along with the White and 8 Balls. Once the first ball is pocketed (directed into 1 of the 6 pockets), that group of balls will be designated to that player for the rest of the game.

The first player to pocket all their balls and then pocket the 8 Ball wins. Winning the game is determined by players shot selection and tactical safety play.

Balls can only move in straight lines, either Vertically, horizontally or diagonally along the board. Much like a queen piece in the game of chess. Always moving the white ball first, players choose which direction to move other balls and in addition have the option to move the white ball in preparation for their next shot. Using the dice, will help to determine how many moves a player possess and how they want to use them.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: På dybt vand
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

75 grader N, 148 grader V.

Bryan havde forventet at gå fra forstanden efter en time, allersenest efter to. Mærkeligt nok var det ikke sket. Hans tøj var gennemblødt af iskoldt havvand. Frederick og David flød kolde omkring i vandet, der stadig steg fra dørken. Han var ensom. I en kæntret atom-ubåd. Tusind fod under pakisen. Med en tikkende a-bombe.

NAS Adak, Alaska, 2000 km mod syd.

Kommander Kevin Nunn fik aldrig drukket sin kop kaffe. Langsomt mistede den sin varme, mens han atter læste den ordre, der lige var tikket ind fra Washington. Han havde en halv time tid at samle sit hold. Om ni timer skulle de være over den arktiske parkis.

Kom med på dybt vand som en gruppe fra flådens efterretningstjeneste. Her er den X-File, som Tom Clancy aldrig fik skrevet.

boardgame.name: UNO: Disney Fairies
boardgame.description:
Disney Fairies customized UNO is the pixie-dust filled version of the classic game that combines the magic of Disney Fairies with the fun of UNO! Customized Disney Fairies cards plus the exclusive Flitterific card!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Imuri
boardgame.description: Imuri was invented independently by Klaus Munro, who later became a famous writer and composer, and in so doing became less interested in defending whatever rights he may have had to the game. The grid is 30x30, which would be significantly deeper than Randolph's 24x24, but the production quality was much better for Twixt.

boardgame.name: Rentnerjagd: Erweiterung
boardgame.description:
Rentner Jagd - Erweiterung expands the cooperative strategy card game Rentner Jagd. In turn-based battles you compete against the game as a team of 1-4 players (5 players with the optional Overlord mode). Random elements in the game setup and during the game always present you with new challenges, even if you play the same missions multiple times.

The expansion features fresh retirees and missions, an additional team of retirees hunters and an all-new Overlord game mode. The Overlord game mode is optional. With the contents of the expansion, you can continue to fight the game together. The new pensioner hunters can be freely combined with those of the basic game.

In the future everything will be networked - including retirees. Their countless high-tech implants and prostheses form a gigantic computing network, in the depths of which an artificial pensioner intelligence - or R.I. for short - goes unnoticed. - grows up, who seeks revenge on the youth-mad society because of miserable care conditions and a lack of respect for old age. As an overlord, a player takes control of the masses of retirees and, equipped with numerous special skills, competes alone against a team of retired hunters.

boardgame.name: Die Verschwundene
boardgame.description:
(from the back of the book)
The investigators take part on the search for a missing girl as volunteers. But Crawling Thing noticed the girl and tries to lead the investigators astray by paranormal phenomena to finally take the girl's young body
(additional information)
this was a free goodie at Conspiracy con 7

boardgame.name: The Cup of the God Egg
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Cup of the God Egg is a system neutral / Troikaish RPG adventure made for #adventurejam.

On this double-sided (and egg-shaped if you do it properly) A4 adventure you'll liberate the one true egg grail from the Shelly collection, grab some treasures from the gift shop and encounter some middle-class horrors.

boardgame.name: 1-48TACTIC: Race for Gasoline
boardgame.description:
A mission pack expansion for 1-48TACTIC, set in 1944, during the Ardennes offensive. A small group of German Volksgrenadier fight it off with US Airborne for the control of a fuel dump.
Requires at least 1 starter pack per faction and the basic rulebook, works better with a couple of extra additional figures.

Includes:

a booklets with all the rules;
a unique metal figures of a German soldier running with a jerrycan and a 25mm round plastic base;
three resin fuel dump models (each 80x40mm)
one jerrycan sticks (6 jerrycans);
ten numbered fold and cut-out dummy


markers with corresponding tokens;

three fold and cut-out fuel markers.


Requires items from the base game to play.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

boardgame.name: Varulv
boardgame.description:
In ‘Varulv’ the classic game of werewolf and Norse mythology meets.

To get started a game master is needed (the bard), who knows all the rules and the roles of each player. When the bard is ready You can get started.

The players are split into two teams: Citizens of Asgard and Asgardians against the evil werewolves, which will do anything to initiate Ragnarok. The player play multiple rounds during the game. These rounds are split into ‘The day’ and ‘The night’.

However, nobody knows the roles of the other players. The accusations will fly through the air. A vote will decide who will be lynched.

Will the citizens of Asgard and the Asgardians succeed in finding and killing the werewolves or will this be the beginning of Ragnarok?

boardgame.name: Curb Your Enthusiasm
boardgame.description:
A PRETTY, PRETTY, PRETTY GOOD PARTY GAME: In this hilarious party game, players compete to be the ultimate Larry David; When you're Larry, uncomfortable run-ins are inevitable; For 3-6 players ages 17 and up.

MAKING EXCUSES: It's your excuses that separate the winning Larry from the others; See if you can pair the best excuse with familiar situations from Curb Your Enthusiasm and have a prett-ay prett-ay good time while you're at it.

TRY AGAIN, LARRY: Find yourself in a variety of cringeworthy situations from the show and push for your excuse to win the round; The first player to collect 5 Situation Cards wins.

boardgame.name: Convoy: Deadly Waters – Rising Storm
boardgame.description:
The time is 1939-40. Many of the anti submarine lessons of WW1 have been forgotten. But Hitler has thrown an unprepared world into WW2 and under Admiral Karl Doenitz the U Boat menace has returned to the North Atlantic.

Take command of Allied convoys as they struggle to relearn the lessons and deal with ever more deadly Nazi submarines. But other dangers also lurk. Well armed surface raiders are at sea and aircraft are becoming a growing menace. In the North Sea area the enemy have introduced fast motor torpedo craft. British ASW methods are barely adequate. French ASW is antiquated. But the convoys must get through.

This game can be played solo or with several players and is designed for use with players own warship miniatures or counters.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Convoy: Deadly Waters – The Gibraltar Run 1941-1942

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 1-48TACTIC: Lanzerath Ridge – Hold at all costs!
boardgame.description:
A mission pack expansion for 1-48TACTIC, set in 1944, during the Ardennes offensive, based on the real Battle of Lanzerath Ridge which was fought on the very first day of the Battle of the Bulge, near the village of Lanzerath, Belgium, along the key route for the German advance on the northern shoulder of the operation. A small group of US Infantry facing a whole German battalion of Fallschirmjägers try to hold off overwhelmingly superior forces for as long as possible.

The US forces here plays an outnumbered defender that must delay the German attacker as long as possible. The German forces are overwhelmingly superior and will eventually prevail, but the limited amount of AT available greatly limit the ability of the German player to exploit his superiority in men and firepower. Moreover the attackers have to move to reach their objective, while the defenders can use most of their Actions to fire on them.

pack includes:
• A 52 pages full color booklet with all the rules;
• A special metal figures of a German Fallschirmjäger armed with a rifle grenade launcher (25mm round plastic base included);
• A special resin figures of a US soldier firing a .50 M2 machine gun (two models of which are also included);
• Resin models of a small log hut, a camouflaged timber pillbox and a dug-in armored jeep.

Requires items from the base game to play.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Society Scenario #3-01
Year of Shattered Sanctuaries
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-4.

A recently inducted Pathfinder field agent makes a startling discovery as pleas for assistance flock to the Society’s Grand Lodge from across the Inner Sea. A group of Pathfinders come to assist in parsing the ongoing damage to the Society when a staunch ally requests their assistance. Stepping into a problem close to home, the agents quickly uncover a larger plot set to tear the Society apart and that it’s up to them to raise the alarm!

Intro: Year of Shattered Sanctuaries is the introduction to the ongoing story of the Year of Shattered Sanctuaries. It is also the first scenario in a four-part arc detailing the events taking place in and around the Society's headquarters at the Grand Lodge in Absalom, the City of Lost Omens. Other arcs explore other locations across the Inner Sea. While the arcs can be played in any order, it is recommended that players experience the scenarios within each individual arc in order, and this scenario is a natural starting point for the Year 3 metaplot as a whole.

boardgame.name: The Blackwood Abundance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:
A Pathfinder Bounty designed for Level 1.

A recent rescue mission led to the discovery of many ruined sites from an ancient civilization. Some of the ruins contain an abundance of strange mushrooms, and a curious explorer asks the PCs to help collect and identify them. This adventure ties to events in Pathfinder Society Intro #2: United In Purpose, though it does not assume the PCs are members of the Pathfinder Society.

boardgame.name: Sloths vs Kraken
boardgame.description:
It's Sloths vs Kraken in a race to spell KRAKEN first. Use tactical Sloth cards to slow your opponents from spelling KRAKEN while you race to build the word yourself. Use Tornadoes, Wipeout Balls, LolliSloth Ladies, X-Ray Vision, Slam Dunks, DJ Skills, Pickpocketing and Bank Robbery to edge ahead in summoning the sea monster from the depths. A party or warm up game that can be played quickly and taught even quicker.

Each turn a player plays a card out of their hand of 7. The card effects are played out and then the player replenishes their hand back up to 7 cards from either the draw pile or the top card of the discards. Card effects include stealing cards from other players, wiping out other players hands, looking at other players hands, blocking another players effect card.

The game moves around the players until one of them spells the word KRAKEN with the letter cards and shouts KRAKEN. Any player that has 5 letters of the word KRAKEN must shout AHOY or forfeit their hand and start with a fresh hand.

boardgame.name: Pocket Aquarium: Goldfish & Castle
boardgame.description:
The Goldfish expansion adds 4 goldfish to the base game, each with a new unique action. There's also a Net to help you with its own special action.

The Castle expansion is used together with the Goldfish expansion for an even bigger aquarium. It has (you've guessed it) a castle as well as an extra fish of each species which means larger schools and higher points targets to aim for.

Each expansion consists of 5 cards plus a rules card and both expansions will fit in the base game box.

boardgame.name: The Lost Wood
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A bit of fun - a single page quest I co-wrote with my son so we could learn the mechanics of TROIKA!

boardgame.name: There Was an Old Lady
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Bilious beasts from a rotten maw! A queasy dose of MÖRK BORG lore!

boardgame.name: The Bone of Batrasaxas
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Inspired by English magical folklore surrounding the Society of the Horseman's Word.

The production of this magical relic is a secret closely guarded by the Sodality of Bestial Whispers. Used in conjunction a throatily rasped utterance of the sacred word ‘ONE’, this enchanted toad bone makes any animal it touches devoted to the wielder - although great skill is required to execute the enchantment.

It seems the original intention of the Bone of Batrasaxas was for animal husbandry - to tame horses, and so forth… Later, members of the Sodality realised that it also worked on humans. Rogue Sodalites became corrupted by the power of the bone. Some enslaved the farmers who once employed them, some dominated and manipulated lovers, while others even enchanted whole villages, making themselves objects of devotion to fanatical cult devotees.

Includes: Background and rules for using the Bone of Batrasaxas; Stats for Yelga, Maistress of the Sodality.

boardgame.name: All in a Day's Work
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Got a group of new players? Maybe they're kids? Want to teach them the basics of Dungeons and Dragons 5e?

Good news! Contained within the PDF below is a single session long adventure that slowly introduces all the basic concepts of D&D in a welcoming environment.

You'll show your players how to:

- Do a skill check
- Do a savings roll
- Engage in combat
- Do a little roleplaying
- Have lots of fun

There are also Dungeon Master tips to help aspiring DMs feel more comfortable in their role and help their players and themselves have a great time!

You'll learn about:

- Encouraging party cooperation
- Handling new and inexperienced players
- Accommodating different forms of roleplaying
- Reflecting player diversity in your stories

boardgame.name: So You Want To Be A Mothman
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

an you outsmart your fellow mothmen and be the first to lay hands (paws? claws?) on this century's greatest prize - the legendary Lamp of Point Pleasant

This fun little TTRPG is created in the vein of Crash Pandas or Honey Heist; a one-shot adventure full of shenanigans and colorful characters.

It can be played with as many people as you can find, though I recommend at least three (two mothman and the GM).

Enjoy, and stay safe you courageous cryptids!
boardgame.rpg: So You Want To Be A Mothman

boardgame.name: Blood Mountain Resort & Spa
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Come to the wonderful Blood Mountain Resort & Spa to take a break from adventuring. Take a relaxing dip into the mud pits, get a tan on the beach, or drink a nice cocktail. Don’t mind the rumbling volcano, though. And the chanting sounds you hear at night is probably just the local wildlife. Pay no attention to all that noise...

This pamphlet includes:

- Keyed map of the island, illustrated by Evlyn Moreau
- 2 Major NPCs, illustrated by Hairic
- Resort activities to relieve stress

The NPCs are statted for DURF but easily adaptable to your analog adventure game of choice.

boardgame.name: Deadlands Poker Decks
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

Draw, Pardner!
Enter the Weird West of Deadlnds with this double deck of full-color, casino-quality poker cards. As any gambler worth his salt can tell you, it's all in the cards. Perfect for use with Deadlands, The Great Rail Wars, or just around the table.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: El Juego de Cartas – Sube la Marea Roja: Escenario de Desafío
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Red Tide Rising: Challenge Scenario
boardgame.description:
'The last thing Wendy Adams expected was to learn of a potential clue to her father’s whereabouts. What secrets is the town of Innsmouth keeping from her? Can she last long enough to find out?

Red Tide Rising is a special print-and-play challenge scenario for Arkham Horror: The Card Game designed to be played with the Wendy Adams character.

This scenario can be played as either a standalone scenario or as a side-story inserted into any campaign. In order to play this scenario, a copy of the Core Set, The Innsmouth Conspiracy Deluxe Expansion, and the printed print-and-play files are required.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Arkham Horror TCG – Challenge Scenarios & Parallel Investigators
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Innsmouth Conspiracy: Expansion

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Risiko!: Batman – La Caduta Di Gotham City
Risk: Batman
boardgame.description:
RisiKo! The most loved strategy game in a special edition set in the DC world! As one of Gotham City's Super-Villains you will descend on the city to conquer it! Strategically strengthen your armies on the districts of the city under your control, attack the neighboring districts to expand your dominion. Try to reach your goal and defeat your opponents to remain the only ones left on the board and win!

In this game we find ourselves playing the opponents of the superhero. The title includes up to a maximum of four players, who can however choose from the most iconic villains of Gotham City: Bane, Joker, Catwoman, Mr. Freeze, The Riddler and Harley Quinn.

This is a first new element compared to the classic version of RisiKo! In fact, each villain will have a Criminal Plan to carry out, developed in different missions (such as taking control of specific territories or making certain results with the dice). Achieving a certain number of objectives will activate the character's special powers, giving the player various advantages during the rest of the game.

Clearly while the villains compete for the districts of Gotham City (following the traditional RisiKo! dice-rolling mechanic!) Our hero is not standing idle. When five 1's are rolled during a turn, Batman goes into action, clearing one or more territories on the board and wreaking havoc in the fight for control of the metropolis. Especially in the initial stages it will not be easy to watch, but it will always be a great emotion to swoop into our opponents. It will be less pleasant when it's our turn to face the Dark Knight, but that's part of the challenge too.

In addition to conquering all of Gotham, you can take home the game by completing one of three objectives, common to all participants. However, every time a criminal empire is definitively defeated, the player who accomplished the feat can choose to eliminate one of the conditions.


RisiKo! Il Gioco di strategia più amato in una edizione speciale ambientata nel mondo DC! Nei panni di uno dei Supercriminali di Gotham City scenderete in città per conquistarla! Rinforzate strategicamente le vostre armate sui distretti della città sotto il vostro controllo, attaccate i distretti confinanti per ampliare il vostro dominio. Cercate di raggiungere il vostro obiettivo e sconfiggete i vostri avversari per restare gli unici rimasti sulla plancia e vincere!

boardgame.name: Peaky Blinders: Birmingham Domain
boardgame.description:
Peaky Blinders: Birmingham Domain is a card game published directly by a Brazilian company, set in the scene of the famous TV series.

Players embody the top five gangs from the series Peaky Blinders in a fierce battle for hegemony in the Birmingham region. Therefore, it is not enough to expand their territories and open pubs. You will need to use your own gang's special skill wisely, create a working network for your (illicit) activities to thrive, get the most out of the characters and use the best moment to attack (or defend against) your opponents. Mechanics and themes were matured by the expertise of designer Marcos Macri and his long creative process. The result is an exciting, fun and balanced card game. You don't need to know or like the show to enjoy this game, but fans will delight in the elegance of the artwork and character reincarnation.

In his turn, the player has three options: expand his region or open a new business, laying down cards in his table; or receive profits from the table itself. It's also possible to use the effect of different characters to optimize actions and improve gang development.

After the endgame is triggered (the pubs cards or the territory cards have run out), the leader who scores more points wins and achieves supremacy over rival gangs.

boardgame.name: Best of the West
boardgame.description:
Best of the West is an open-world game set in the Wild West! It features asymmetrical gameplay where you can go it alone as a Pioneer or join up with the co-op Bandit Gang. Since the game is heavily player vs player, it requires both Pioneers and Bandits in similar numbers. A single Round consists of the Pioneer turns (rotating player order) and then Bandit Gang's turn (any order). Either the Bandit Gang team or the Pioneer with the highest Reputation at the end of 25 Rounds wins the game.

For Pioneers, Reputation is mostly earned by doing a job (Panning or Mining for Gold, Herding Livestock, Trapping for Furs). For Bandits, Reputation is primarily gained by robbing the Pioneers. Additional cash and Reputation can be earned by robbing the Train, Saloon, and Bank or by performing a Jailbreak. Cash allows you to load up with Weapons, Items, and Pets. Power Cards that grant extra abilities, upgrades, and utility bonuses can be collected around the map at the Indian Village, Saloon, and Ghost Town.

Pioneers move using Movement Cards and can also ride the Train that travels around the map every Round. Bandits move either by using Movement Cards or Ambush Cards. Ambush Cards allow a Bandit to secretly hide on a space on the board. Battling is primarily dice-based, but also includes Power Cards and character abilities.

boardgame.name: Seize the Bean: Extra Founders Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
From the Snack Menu (Expansions) Rulebook: An additional 6 Founder Cards are included in the 5-6 Player Expansion, sold separately. They are also available as a standalone, add-on back for players who do not intend to play the game with more than 4 players, but who don't want to miss out on all of the extra content. These 6 Founders work identically to the Base Founders and simply add more variation to the game.

All of the additional 6 Founders pay tribute to real people who contributed massively to the creation of Seize the Bean. They don't own cafés in real life so their corresponding cafés are fictional ones, created for fun and to support some very imaginative Solo Scenarios.

The cards in the pack include:
-Adriano Rahde (Hungry Media)
-Rodrigo Cunha (Cyclists)
-Priscilla Anton (Happy Families)
-Nala Q. (Fashionistas)
-Salome Q. (Funemployed Expats)
-Jazzbot™ (Tourists)
